name: Vin de Constance 2007
description:
Bottled decadence, 2007 is the latest iconic dessert wine from unbotrytised Muscat de Frontignan. New oak (65%) melts into unctuous glacé pineapple and barley sugar flavours. Rich and complex, but lacks the vibrant freshness of exceptional 2006 (5 stars).' - Platter's SA Wine Guide 2013, 4.5☆ ‘*It has an explosive bouquet that sprints out of the blocks with a more effervescent, vivacious personality than the 2008. Citrus lemon, Seville orange marmalade, touches of mandarin and a dash of spice all vie for attention … This is probably the finest Vin de Constance to date as it fans out marvellously on the multi-layered finish. This is a startling, world-class wine that gives Yquem a run for its money.*’ Neal Martin, Wine Advocate, 97/100 (2011)

 The wines will continue to be cellared at the Klein Constantia’s vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2031) or withdrawal. Vin de Constance is not produced every year. If a vintage is not produced, the NFT will include the next vintage, to total 40 consecutive vintages.
